results.title: Teeth are to keep
results.creator_credit: Dino Rigolo, Jim MacKay, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A gaily colored cartoon with a cheerful little story to drive home the importance of the four essentials of tooth care. The film shows the function of various teeth and the foods that will help to keep them healthy. Brushing teeth after every meal is stressed, as well as yearly visits to the dentist. Animation reveals how a tooth decays.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dino Rigolo, Jim MacKay, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Teamwork
results.brief_description: Six means by which cooperation can be achieved are illustrated by a group of high school students planning a dance. Leadership, bargaining, trickery, exploitation, compromise, democratic cooperation are shown as students complete arrangements. Introduction and summary show out-of-school examples of same methods.

results.title: Farmyard stories = better move on frog ...
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers in a farmyard setting and have been selected for children aged one to five years old. The stories are: “Mrs. Mopple’s washing line”, “Sophie and Jack”, “Better move on frog”, “Teddy at the seaside”, “Bookload of animals”, “Mr. Ginger’s potato”, “Wilberforce goes on a picnic”, “Ambo and the little elephant”, “Peter Pipers at the wildlife park”, “Hairy Mclary from Donaldson’s dairy” Introduced by Dorothy Butler.

results.title: Stories afloat = lighthouse keeper's lunch
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by Dorothy Butler and Don Kjestrup as they take a group of children for a sail in a yacht. The stories have been selected for children aged eight to eleven years old. The stories are: “A bag of wind”, The magic apple”, Scruffy, scruffy dog”, “Mrs. Vineagar” “Shuttle burn”, “Mrs. McGinty and the bizarre plant”, “Gumdrop and the farmer’s friend”, “Pelican”, “Rapunzel” and “The lighthouse keeper’s lunch”

results.title: Teaching a language structure by the Australian situational method. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Ian Hart, John Morris and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Part 2 shows excerpts from the teaching of the interrogative and negative patterns, and the long and short answer forms of the verb “to have”. It again lays emphasis on the lesson steps of the situational method, and has a final sequence showing students at work in a language laboratory.
results.title_for_label: Teaching a language structure by the Australian situational method. Part 2
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Hart, John Morris and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.description: Part 2 shows excerpts from the teaching of the interrogative and negative patterns, and the long and short answer forms of the verb “to have”. It again lays emphasis on the lesson steps of the situational method, and has a final sequence showing students at work in a language laboratory.
description_for_label: Part 2 shows excerpts from the teaching of the interrogative and negative patterns, and the long and short answer forms of the verb “to have”. results.title: Teaching nutrition: cross age tutoring
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath, International Video Books and Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit
results.brief_description: A short program for teachers to view before they become involved in nutrition education. It uses the cross age tutoring approach but the message is equally important regardless of the teaching strategies to be used. For both primary and secondary teachers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerben Cath, International Video Books and Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit

results.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II: the secret of the ooze (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Michael Pressman, David Chan, Kim Dawson, Thomas K. Gray, Gary Propper and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: The four hip superheroes Raphael, Leonardo, Michaelangelo and Donatello continue their bodacious adventures as they find a new sewer home and with the help of curvaceous TV reporter April O’Neil, Professor Jordon and Keno, the pizza delivery boy they battle the Foot gang and other mutant villains to discover their origins, to save New York and to keep the mutant-causing green ooze from falling into evil hands.
results.title_for_label: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II: the secret of the ooze (Captioned)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Pressman, David Chan, Kim Dawson, Thomas K. Gray, Gary Propper and Golden Harvest

results.title: Timeless stories = The Witch and the owl ...
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
Dorothy Butler introduces this video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged eight to eleven years old. The stories are: “The Musicians of Bremen”, “The Writing on the wall”, “Did you ever?”, “Chanticleer”, “Mr. and Mrs. Hay the horse”, “Mabel’s story”, “The Witch and the owl”, “Funnybones” and “Jorinda and Joringel”.
